intro: Primula caespitosa, commonly known as the tufted primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It features a dense, low-growing rosette of dark green, hairy leaves that form a compact base. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, showy flowers in shades of yellow, white, or pink, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
